channel.title: Theme on $ cd /home/
channel.description: Recent content in Theme on $ cd /home/

item.title: Coronavirus tracker
item.description: About During the first lockdown hearing about COVID-19 all day long prompted me to develop a small app to visualize the evolution of the pandemic around the world. An application to analyze data on the coronavirus / COVID-19 virus by giving the number of deaths, confirmed, active person recovered worldwide. The app provides detailed information in each country. Charts and histograms are available to assess the number of deaths, confirmed active and recovering by country.

item.description: If you want to use Twitter’s Twemoji across your website, enable it in your config.toml [params] enableTwemoji = true This will not only give your website unified emojis across all platforms. item.title: Render LaTeX using KaTeX
item.description: Enable katex by adding katex = "true" to the front matter +++ katex = "true" +++ If you want to enable KaTeX or MathJax for all post, add katex = ture or math = true in config.toml in [params] section. It’s almost a dropin alternative to the mathjax solution,you should just choose one of them. Inline math looks like this This is text with inline math $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} =1$ This is text with inline math $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} = 1$

item.description: Style Demo h1 Heading h2 Heading h3 Heading h4 Heading h5 Heading h6 Heading This is bold text This is bold text This is italic text This is italic text Deleted text This is text with inline math $\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} = 1$ and with math blocks: $$ \sum_{n=1}^{\infty} 2^{-n} = 1 $$ Heading Another heading text text text text text text Block quotes are written like so.

item.title: Ilot
item.description: Table of contents Introduction Architecture 2.1. The corpus 2.2. Population step 2.2.1 Annotation 2.2.2 Population 2.3 Enrichment step 2.3.1 With general data 2.3.2 With specific data 2.4 Exploitation step Partenaires Publications Links Introduction The ILOT (Innovative Learning Object for Teaching) project is a collaborative project that combines Gutenberg technologies, LeLivreScolaire, Alcatel Lucent et Telecom ParisTech to provide a resource repository pedagogical allowing the collaborative development of such resources, their annotation and their use in different modes of consultation.

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content. I’ll explain how Hugo uses templates and how you can organize your templates to create a theme. I won’t cover using CSS to style your theme. We’ll start with creating a new site with a very basic template.

item.title: ScaleSem
item.description: Table of contents Introduction Semantic graphs qualification 2.1. The processing steps 2.1.1 The graph exploration 2.1.2 Determination of a root 2.1.3 Model generation 2.2. The checking process Querying semantic graphs The CLOCK methodology Conclusion Publications Links Thanks Introduction The increasing development of networks and especially the Internet has greatly expanded the gap between heterogeneous information systems. In a review of studies of interoperability of heterogeneous information systems, we find that all the work in this area tends to be in solving the problems of semantic heterogeneity.
